moves.1. d4 Nf6 2. c4 e6 3. Nf3 d5: This is a kind of Nimzo Indian defence very solid position both side  I used often against 1.d4
moves.6. a3 a4: Just setting a simple trap  everyone must find out if opponent takes the Bishop then white lost Queen and game also
moves.7. Qc2 Bxc3+ 8. bxc3: White make a mistake he needs to take with the Queen
moves.8... dxc4 9. Bg5 b5: Now I have an extra pawn and protected very well
This move make happy because I have my eyes on a8 to h1 diagonal this diagonal make my Bishop special when end game  will start
moves.14... Qe7 15. Rfe1 Bb7: My favorite place for my special Bishop
moves.16. Nd2 c5 17. dxc5: Now Black Knight have a good and ideal place on C5
moves.17... Nxc5 18. Bf3 Nb3: I hope opponent avoid to take my b7 Bishop and opponent really avoid
moves.21. Nd4: After this Knight exchange offer victory is easy for me
moves.21... Nxd4 22. Rxd4 Rfd8 23. Rdd1: When you have extra material go for exchanges so exchange the Rook
moves.23... Rxd1 24. Rxd1 Qb3: Offering Queen for more easier win
moves.25. Qc1: Not accepted this offer by my opponent but a4 pawn decide the Matter
moves.25... a3 26. Qa1 a2 27. h3: And here I I give a Queen gift to my opponent but opponent resignation and Black won
